summary: This is an email from a prosecutor to colleagues regarding discovery disclosures in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It references a prior discovery letter to Epstein and proposes providing a specific witness statement to Ghislaine Maxwell. The statement describes a witness (Witness-1) who disclosed to Palm Beach detectives in 2005 that Epstein paid her to bring underage girls for sexualized massages, with Epstein stating 'the younger the better.'

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal investigation; the witness statement describes him paying for underage girls for sexualized massages.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of the proposed discovery disclosure; the email discusses providing her with a witness statement.

persons.name: Witness-1
persons.context: An individual who disclosed to Palm Beach detectives in 2005 that Epstein paid her to bring underage girls for sexualized massages.

persons.name: Rita Glavin
persons.context: Represented Witness-1, as noted in the referenced witness statement.

connections.description: Epstein paid Witness-1 to bring underage girls to him for sexualized massages, as disclosed in the 2005 witness statement.
Both are defendants in the case; the email concerns sharing discovery material (a witness statement) with Maxwell.
Rita Glavin is identified as the attorney representing Witness-1.

events.title: Palm Beach Police Department Investigation
events.description: During the Palm Beach Department's investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, Witness-1 disclosed to detectives that Epstein paid her to bring underage girls for sexualized massages.

events.title: Prosecutor Email Regarding Discovery
events.description: A prosecutor emails colleagues to propose providing a specific 2005 witness statement to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense as part of discovery.

keyFacts: A witness (Witness-1) disclosed to Palm Beach detectives in 2005 that Jeffrey Epstein paid her to bring girls for sexualized massages.
Epstein told Witness-1 'the younger the better' and complained one girl over eighteen was 'too old,' indicating a preference for underage victims.
Witness-1 described bringing multiple girls under the age of eighteen to Epstein's Florida residence.
The prosecutor is seeking approval to disclose this witness statement to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
Witness-1 is represented by attorney Rita Glavin.
